title: EURid October 2019 Finalisation
description:
Description
Management Summary
Finalisation of the EURid's code breaking changes Oct. 2019
Inclusion of citizenship in DuD
Bug fixes (found while implementing the feature DUD-9118)
Description of Demand / Problem
Current state; What have we done so far:
We have implemented the feature DUD-9118. Sprint 4.9.4 vWBA 23.10.2019
The implemented feature is a workaround, because we just use the countryCode (CC) to set the countryOfCitizenship, but the CC is an address based value and might differ from the holder's countryOfCitizenship 
several bug fixes are needed (all legacy)
 Finalisation; Next steps: 
Final state code breaking changes Oct. 2019:
countryOfCitizenship is stored in database
countryOfCitizenship is part of the NicContainer for EURid
countryOfCitizenship is part of the RegistrarService-Interface
Detailed consultation with TPD necessary 
add SubAction "ForceContactModfy" to RegistrarService-Interface (polling.xsd)
revert changes/workaround made under DUD-9153.
Extend interface agreement dcumentation
Create and deliver NicContainer dcumentation
ValidationService can handle countryOfCitizenship
Detailed consultation with TPD necessary
New error code&test needed?
Contact- and Domain-Synchonization can handle countryOfCitizenship
New/Changed regressiontests (Soap-UI) 
Bug fixes (all legacy):
Changes for Onsite-C (technically a Tech-C) has to be confirmed (ContactModify-Order, not within a domain related order)
contact-ext:lang is set hardcoded to "en", why?
Synchronization of a contact (type organisation) looses First- and Lastname
Acceptance Criteria
Citizenship of the contacts is displayed in the GUI and transferred to EURid.
Checklist
  DoD: Gepr√ºft von Scrum Master.
acceptance_criteria:
